data.title: Line Breaks with Slash
data.solution:
n = int(input())
ans = ""
illegal_flag = False
for _ in range(n):
  line = input()
  ans += line.replace("/", "\n")

trans = str.maketrans({" ": None, "\n": None})
checker = ans.translate(trans)
if checker == "":
  illegal_flag = True

print("Illegal output." if illegal_flag else ans)
data.statement:
A positive integer [[n]] and an [[ASCII string]] spanning [[n]] lines are given.

Remove all the original line breaks, and replace each {{/}} by a line break.
If the resulting output contains <<only whitespace characters (spaces and line breaks)>>, output {{Illegal output.}} instead.

data.constraints:
1 ≤ [[n]] ≤ 100
0 ≤ length of a line of [[ASCII string]] ≤ 50.

<<All characters>> are ASCII.
It is guaranteed that not all lines are empty.
{{/}} never appears at the end of the final input line.
data.stubGenerator:
read n:int
loop n read line:string(100)
write result
data.inputDescription:
<<Line 1:>> A positive integer [[n]].
<<Next [[n]] lines:>> One line of the [[ASCII string]].
data.outputDescription: <<One or more lines:>> The [[ASCII string]] split into lines at each {{/}} or {{Illegal output.}}.

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

A positive integer n and an ASCII string spanning n lines are given.

Remove all the original line breaks, and replace each / by a line break.
If the resulting output contains only whitespace characters (spaces and line breaks), output Illegal output. instead.
Input
Line 1: A positive integer n.
Next n lines: One line of the ASCII string.
Output
One or more lines: The ASCII string split into lines at each / or Illegal output..
Constraints
1 ≤ n ≤ 100
0 ≤ length of a line of ASCII string ≤ 50.

All characters are ASCII.
It is guaranteed that not all lines are empty.
/ never appears at the end of the final input line.
Example
Input
1
abc/def
Output
abc
def
